snippet: The push to censor information on the Internet to citizens beyond the European Union is a troubling idea.
abstract: Editorial warns that European officials and regulators who are pushing for search engine companies like Google to remove global results under its new 'right to be forgotten' principle is opening door to greater censorship of the Internet across the globe; raises possibility that autocratic regimes will use precedent to justify whitewashing history, and that precedent will give companies power to determine when censorship is legitimate or not.
lead_paragraph: The push to censor information on the Internet to citizens beyond the European Union is a troubling idea.
